title.narrative: FAUTAPO 2020-23 Women's Economic Empowerment & market access
FAUTAPO 2020-23 Women's Economic Empowerment & market access

description.narrative:
FAUTAPO har ansökt Sida om finansiering av 35 miljoner SEK för att genomföra projektet "Women's Economic Empowerment and market access" i Bolivia under perioden 2020-2023.
Insatsen syftar till att 1) förbättra kvinnors empowerment på olika nivåer: ekonomiskt, socialt, ledande, produktivt; och 2) att säkerställa tillgång till lokala marknader för de små produktiva enheter som arbetar under det nuvarande bidraget för att slutför a sin ekonomiska cykel. Därmed kommer FAUTAPO att införliva en flerdimensionell fattigdomsanalys i enlighet med Sidas konceptuella ram.

FAUTAPO has applied to Sida for funding of 35 million SEK to carry out the project "Women's Economic Empowerment and market access" in Bolivia during the period 2020-2023.
The intervention aims at 1) improving women's empowerment at different levels: economic, social, managerial, productive; and 2) ensuring access to local markets for the small productive units working under the present contribution complete their economic cycle. In doing so, FAUTAPO will apply a multidimensional poverty analysis in accordance to Sida's conceptual framework.

The final objective of the intervention is to improve men's and women's socioeconomic empowerment of at least 2 100 productive units in 25 selected Bolivian municipalities, while also working with them in the opening of competitive markets for their production to be sold. FAUTAPO has also designed two intermediate effects, including outputs and targets to be measured against, for this intervention to be monitored. The RBM matrix presented and explained in the project document has a detailed description of the above.

tag.narrative: 5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

description.narrative:
Year 2021 was still influenced by the negative effects of the coronavirus presence in the country, as most activities did not return to their normal standards, before the pandemic. The main results achieved during 2021 were:
Goal: Out of 2100 productive units working with FAUTAPO, around 80% of the total (1680) are led by women.
As to 2021, there were 1345 female leaders (76%) and 425 male producers.
As to women's empowerment it should be said that certain setbacks have remained in 2021, given the slow path to economic recovery in the country. Nevertheless, all the productive units, including those led by men, continued receiving training and technical assistance from FAUTAPO. Some of the FAUTAPO's technicians resumed their visits/technical assistance to the producers living in their neighbouring areas. Others received technical assistance by mobile or by internet when connections were possible. However, according to FAUTAPO, during 2021, all the productive units working with them received direct (alive) technical assistance at least once during the year. As to 2021, 59% of the total number of UPFs targeted by FAUTAPO are led by women (the target figure is 60%).
As to market access, as to the end of 2021, 1 554 UPFs (74% of them) have accessed in a competitive manner to different markets, most of them only locally but several of the producers are in the process to access to national markets. In some cases, important delays in achieving the national register for sanitation is an obstacle for the producer to access to national markets. The target figure for a satisfactory compliance of this objective is 80 percent.
In relation to environmental interventions, the end of project goal was to have 100% of the FAUTAPO municipal interventions with sound environmental actions (models to recover ecosystems and waste management). As to 2021, FAUTAPO reports only 88% of advances in 19 municipalities with actions related to environmental practices. The main results achieved during 2021 were:
Goal: Out of 2100 productive units working with FAUTAPO, around 80% of the total (1680) are led by women.
As to 2021, there were 1345 female leaders (76%) and 425 male producers.
As to women's empowerment it should be said that certain setbacks have remained in 2021, given the slow path to economic recovery in the country. Nevertheless, all the productive units, including those led by men, continued receiving training and technical assistance from FAUTAPO. Some of the FAUTAPO's technicians resumed their visits/technical assistance to the producers living in their neighbouring areas. Others received technical assistance by mobile or by internet when connections were possible. However, according to FAUTAPO, during 2021, all the productive units working with them received direct (alive) technical assistance at least once during the year. As to 2021, 59% of the total number of UPFs targeted by FAUTAPO are led by women (the target figure is 60%).
As to market access, as to the end of 2021, 1 554 UPFs (74% of them) have accessed in a competitive manner to different markets, most of them only locally but several of the producers are in the process to access to national markets. In some cases, important delays in achieving the national register for sanitation is an obstacle for the producer to access to national markets. The target figure for a satisfactory compliance of this objective is 80 percent.
In relation to environmental interventions, the end of project goal was to have 100% of the FAUTAPO municipal interventions with sound environmental actions (models to recover ecosystems and waste management). As to 2021, FAUTAPO reports only 88% of advances in 19 municipalities with actions related to environmental practices.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
